<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<rss version="2.0" xml:base="http://www.pion.org"  xmlns:dc="http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/">
<channel>
 <title>Pion Development Community</title>

 <description></description>
 <language>en</language>
<item>
 <title>Pion 1.1.4 is released!</title>
 <link>http://www.pion.org/node/110</link>
 <description><p>Pion 1.1.4 is now available. This is the first public release in the 1.1<br />
branch. We have new reactors (ScriptReactor, OmnitureAnalyticsReactor)<br />
and a completely rewritten TransformReactor. We also have speed<br />
improvements and new UI features.</p>
<p>Community edition:<br />
* New ScriptReactor (232)<br />
* TransformReactor -- refactored with all new features (385, 386, 424)<br />
* All new term selection tool for UI (359, 405, 95)<br />
* FilterReactor UI supports MatchAllValues (383)<br />
* TransformReactor supports MatchAllValues (384, 386)<br />
* Log parsing error no longer skips rest of the log file (311)<br />
* Build updated to Boost 1.36 &amp; 1.37 (314, 270)<br />
* Overall speed improvement due to non-locking config changes (341, 145)<br />
* Fixed unit tests (419, 423)<br />
* Replace "filtering" selects with regular selects in UI (428)<br />
* Count and track errors in HTTPRequestSender (436)</p>
<p>Enterprise edition:<br />
* SnifferReactor has multiple processing threads (220)<br />
* New configurable OmnitureReactor (361, 364, 422)<br />
* AggregateReactor used 100% of CPU if using Object Term (437)</p>
</description>
 <comments>http://www.pion.org/node/110#comments</comments>
 <pubDate>Tue, 17 Feb 2009 01:01:42 +0000</pubDate>
 <dc:creator>Taneli Otala</dc:creator>
 <guid isPermaLink="false">110 at http://www.pion.org</guid>
</item>
<item>
 <title>Pion 1.0.12 Released</title>
 <link>http://www.pion.org/node/106</link>
 <description><p>Pion 1.0.12 is now available.  This release primarily adds support to SnifferReactor and HTTPProtocol for new clickstream vocabulary terms.  A few bug fixes are also included.</p>
<p>Our Community Edition release includes the following updates:</p>
<ul>
<li>Added additional clickstream request and response time stamps (434)
</li><li>Added support to HTTPProtocol for digest HTTP authentication (429)
</li><li>Added support to HTTPProtocol for data center and end user times (433)
</li><li>Added support to HTTPProtocol for various packet counters (430)
</li></ul>
<p>Our Enterprise Edition release includes the following additional updates:</p>
<ul>
<li>Added support to SnifferReactor for various packet counters (430)
</li><li>Added support to SnifferReactor for SSL handshake time (431)
</li><li>Added support to SnifferReactor for client and server MAC addresses (432)
</li><li>GoogleAnalyticsReactor was stopping whenever any error was encountered (435)
</li></ul>
<p>For a summary of all changes, please see our Trac database at:<br />
<a href="http://trac.atomiclabs.com/query?status=new&amp;status=assigned&amp;status=reopened&amp;status=closed&amp;group=component&amp;milestone=Pion+1.0.12&amp;order=owner" title="http://trac.atomiclabs.com/query?status=new&amp;status=assigned&amp;status=reopened&amp;status=closed&amp;group=component&amp;milestone=Pion+1.0.12&amp;order=owner">http://trac.atomiclabs.com/query?status=new&amp;status=assigned&amp;status=reope...</a></p>
<p>Binary and source code downloads are now available on our website at:<br />
<a href="http://www.atomiclabs.com/pion/download.php" title="http://www.atomiclabs.com/pion/download.php">http://www.atomiclabs.com/pion/download.php</a></p>
<p>No changes were made to our "common" or "network" libraries since the previous (1.0.10) release.</p>
</description>
 <comments>http://www.pion.org/node/106#comments</comments>
 <category domain="http://www.pion.org/taxonomy/term/17">Announcements</category>
 <pubDate>Wed, 11 Feb 2009 00:21:31 +0000</pubDate>
 <dc:creator>Mike Dickey</dc:creator>
 <guid isPermaLink="false">106 at http://www.pion.org</guid>
</item>
<item>
 <title>Pion - Rule Your Data</title>
 <link>http://www.pion.org/node/6</link>
 <description><div style="width: 628px; border:1px solid #6096b6; padding: 15px; margin: 0 0 -20px 0; background-color: #d8ecf8; height: auto;">
<h1 style="font-size: 24px; color:#31363e;">Pion 1.0 is now available!</h1>
<div style="width: 266px; border:1px solid #6096b6; padding: 15px; float: left; margin-right: 30px; background-color: #ffffff;">
<h2 style="color: #6096b6; font-size: 20px; border-bottom: 1px dotted #cccccc;"><a href="/projects/pion-platform">Pion&trade; CEP Platform</a></h2>
<p><span style="font-size: 14px;">The open source platform for building complex event processing applications<br />
<br />
<a href="/projects/pion-platform">Learn More</a>&nbsp;&nbsp;|&nbsp;&nbsp;<a href="/projects/pion-platform/download">Download</a></span></p></div>
<div style="width: 266px; border:1px solid #6096b6; padding: 15px; float: left; background-color: #ffffff;">
<h2 style="color: #6096b6; font-size: 20px; border-bottom: 1px dotted #cccccc;"><a href="/projects/pion-network-library">Pion&trade; Network Library</a></h2>
<p><span style="font-size: 14px;">C++ development library for implementing lightweight HTTP interfaces<br />
<br />
<a href="/projects/pion-network-library">Learn More</a>&nbsp;&nbsp;|&nbsp;&nbsp;<a href="/projects/pion-network-library/download">Download</a></span></p></div>
<div style="clear: both;"></div>
</div>
</description>
 <comments>http://www.pion.org/node/6#comments</comments>
 <pubDate>Thu, 14 Feb 2008 18:42:13 +0000</pubDate>
 <dc:creator>Keith Shiley</dc:creator>
 <guid isPermaLink="false">6 at http://www.pion.org</guid>
</item>
</channel>
</rss>
